authors.author: Henry F. Lyte William H. Monk

verse.name: v1a
v1b
verse.lines:
Lord, with me abide!
When other helpers fail

verse.name: v1c
verse.lines:
And comforts flee,
Help of the helpless,
Oh abide with me!

verse.name: v2a
v2b
verse.lines:
Its glories pass away.
Change and decay

verse.name: v2c
v3a
verse.lines:
I need Thy presence
Every passing hour.
What but Thy grace

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
Can foil the tempter's power?
Who, like Thyself,

verse.name: v3c
verse.lines:
My guide and stay can be?
Through cloud and sunshine,
Lord, abide with me.

verse.name: v4a
v4b
verse.lines:
And tears no bitterness.
Where is death's sting?
Where, grave, thy victory?

verse.name: v4c
verse.lines:
I triumph still,
If Thou abide with me.

verse.name: v5a
verse.lines:
Hold Thou Thy cross
Before my closing eyes;

verse.name: v5b
verse.lines:
Shine through the gloom
And point me to the skies.

verse.name: v5c
verse.lines:
Heaven's morning breaks,
And earth's vain shadows flee!

verse.name: v5d
verse.lines:
In life, in death,
O Lord, abide with me!
